I Am Josh A

I specialize in web development

View My Work

What Makes Me Different

Collaboration

I am able to communicate effectively with all parties involved to ensure the project's goal's are understood and implemented in an effective manner. As a medical device representative I used to sell solutions to my customer's pain points. As a developer I now have the oportunity to build those solutions.

Ability To Learn

The ability to learn is one thing but the ability to learn then apply those skills is far superior. My portfolio is filled with examples of my incremental knowledge being built and applied to projects.

Passion

I truely love and am facinated by coding. The move from a very lucrative sales job to starting at the bottom of the totem pole in a new industry was not driven by necessity. It was driven by my desire to be expressing my creativity through the code I write and the effect it has on people who use it.

Putting In The Time

What I lack in experience I make up for in power of will and persistence. I wasn't a top 5% sales rep because I was unnaturally talented at sales. I got there by outworking 95% of the other guys every single day. My work ethic is what makes me different.

My Creative Process

All of my UI/UX and design projects are based off of a practiced formula to get the result that I am looking for

1

Reseach

I have found research is the basic key step to design user experience. When embarking on a new project I first try to understand the market competition. Then learn about the domain and its requirements. Finally I get inspirations and ideas from the best competitors in the space.

2

Sketch

This stage involves UI definition of required features. Sketches, white board flows, wireframes, and mockups are all incorporated here. Focusing on the goals uncovered during research to ensure I make a usable design to achieve end user satisfaction.

3

Design

This is where I turn the initial mockups and wireframes into great looking images with theme and styles applied to them. This results in detailed design specs to take into the implementation step.

4

Implement

Build back-end functionality and front interface. Resulting in developed UI with complete functionality and experience. Evaluate product in terms of user flow and experience to identify areas where improvements are needed. Then make improvements.
